## Installation

The package is available on [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=echarts4r):

```{r, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("echarts4r")
```

You can also install the development version of echarts4r with `devtools` or `remotes` from Github or Bitbucket.

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("JohnCoene/echarts4r") # github
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_bitbucket("JohnCoene/echarts4r") # bitbucket
```

## Example

Create multiple charts, arrange them in a grid and connect their interactions.

```{r}
library(echarts4r)

e1 <- iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  e_charts(
    Sepal.Length,
    elementId = "chart"
  ) %>% 
  e_scatter(Petal.Length, Sepal.Width, scale = "* 3") %>% 
  e_datazoom(show = FALSE, y.index = 0, toolbox = FALSE) %>% 
  e_x_axis(min = 4) %>% 
  e_highlight(series.name = list("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), btn = "high") %>% 
  e_downplay(series.name = list("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), btn = "down") %>% 
  e_button("high", "Highlight", class = "btn btn-primary", position = "bottom") %>% 
  e_button("down", "Downplay", class = "btn btn-default", position = "bottom")

e2 <- iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  e_charts(Sepal.Length) %>% 
  e_line(Petal.Length) %>% 
  e_connect("chart") %>% 
  e_datazoom(y.index = 0) %>% 
  e_x_axis(min = 4) %>% 
  e_legend(FALSE) 

e_arrange(e1, e2, rows = 1, cols = 2)
```
